New Records: Hosts Germany recorded their biggest-ever European Championship win, thumping Scotland 5-1 in their Euro 2024 opener in Munich on Friday.
Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored a penalty at 45'+1'
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal at 87'
Ryan Porteous received a yellow card at 45'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany had 72.8% possession compared to Scotland's 27.2%
Germany had 10 shots on goal while Scotland had 0
Germany had 20 shot attempts while Scotland had 1
Germany had 5 corner kicks while Scotland had 0
